intro: Diascia nana, commonly known as dwarf diascia, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to South Africa. It features small, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and orange, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its short stature and vibrant blooms make it an attractive addition to gardens with limited space.
